paper.title: The NYU Ultracomputer—Designing an MIMD Shared Memory Parallel Computer

author.org: Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences, New York University
University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign;

paper.abstract: We present the design for the NYU Ultracomputer, a shared-memory MIMD parallel machine composed of thousands of autonomous processing elements. This machine uses an enhanced message switching network with the geometry of an Omega-network to approximate the ideal behavior of Schwartzu0027s paracomputer model of computation and to implement efficiently the important fetch-and-add synchronization primitive. We outine the hardware that would be required to build a 4096 processor system using 1990u0027s technology. We also discuss system software issues, and present analytic studies of the network performance. Finally, we include a sample of our effort to implement and simulate parallel variants of important scientific programs.
